dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2294 IH: To reauthorize the Integrated Coastal and Ocean Observation System Act of 2009.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ezell (for himself, Ms. Bonamici, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mrs. Dingell, Mrs. Radewagen, and Mr. Davis of Illinois) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Science, Space, and Technology, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To reauthorize the Integrated Coastal and Ocean Observation System Act of 2009.

section.header: Reauthorization of Integrated Coastal and Ocean Observation System Act of 2009
section.text: The Integrated Coastal and Ocean Observation System Act of 2009 (33 U.S.C. 3601 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Council each place it appears and inserting Committee;

clause.text: in the heading, by striking Council and inserting Committee; and
by striking National Ocean Research Leadership Council and inserting Ocean Policy Committee; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (6), by inserting conduct operational oceanography measurements and after in order to;
by inserting and ocean after weather each place it appears; and

clause.text: in the heading of paragraph (1), by striking Council and inserting Committee; and

subclause.text: by redesignating clauses (vi) through (x) as clauses (vii) through (xi), respectively; and
by inserting after clause (v) the following:

clause.text: develop requirements and processes for regional offices and federally funded projects of the agencies of the Interagency Ocean Observation Committee to collaborate with the regional coastal observing systems for data sharing at regional levels;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (5), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: $56,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030.
